result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:38 PM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: B Harris, Defendant Brandon John Eide appeared by video.  Attorney Matthew Dobbe appeared by video for Brandon John Eide.  Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin. ADA Becker recites joint agreement.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 1- AMENDED Possession Hallucinogenic and Stimulant drug in 22CF233. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in 22CF233.  Sentencing arguments.  ADA Becker will file an amended complaint. 

Court Orders: Ct 1 in 22CF233

S/W 18 Months Probation

- Court Costs: $243.00    
- DNA Sample and Surcharge: $200.00
Payable through COC office
DE to be set up on monthly payment plan at $50 per month, commencing 10/1/22. 

Conditions of Probation:

- Absolute sobriety
- Comply with AODA treatment plan
- Complete any and all programming by COMPAS Assessment
- Report to Probation no later than 9:00 AM 8/25/22, court authorizes telephone contact

CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:  Michael Joseph Becker. Brandon John Eide pro se via zoom. Case called at 8:36 a.m. Court notes this matter is set for a status conference. for continuance. Filed by DE. arc    Per RMW on 4-17-2022: "Def can appear by Zoom" JA will call and provide the Zoom instructions. arc
Pretrial Assessment Report. hml
Status conference on April 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, George W. The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:   Michael Joseph Becker   DF ATTY:  Abrianna Dolfi for purposes of today only.  DF:  Brandon John Eide appeared from jail via video. DE has a copy of complaint. Address and DOB confirmed. Address and DOB confirmed. Does not qualify for PD services. Given PFAC. Court finds good cause for exceeding time limits to appoint counsel.  Status conference scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
